title: Oscars 2017 Red Carpet: Michelle Williams’s Louis Vuttion Dress - Vogue

organizations.name: louis vuttion dress - vogue michelle williams channels

text: Michelle Williams Channels a Beloved Icon of French Film at the Oscars February 27, 2017 2:22 AM by Maria Ward Photo: Getty Images Michelle Williams is nominated for best supporting actress at tonight’s Oscars . From a fashion perspective, however, Williams is fully committed to the house of Louis Vuitton. When the Manchester by the Sea actress floated onto the Academy Awards red carpet in Nicolas Ghesquière–designed black velvet halter gown with heavily embroidered skirt, she looked every bit the leading lady. Williams’s stylist, Kate Young, revealed the moment drew inspiration from a photograph of Jean Seberg, the American icon of French New Wave cinema. “There are three different textures, and it took a century!” Young said. “It’s magical.” The dramatic plunging neckline was a new twist for Williams, and she did well to eschew competing details up top. She opted instead for simple diamond stud earrings and a matching bracelet—the overall effect was subtle and sophisticated. Williams, who has been the face of Louis Vuitton’s accessories campaigns on several occasions, doubled down on metallics with the brand’s silver envelope clutch and coordinating velvet platform sandals for what was perhaps a nod to Seberg’s minimalist sense of glamour. What’s French for “and the Oscar goes to?” In This Story: Oscars , Michelle Williams Recommended For You
